gurmukhi: kwlI smyq sBY skqI imil dIno Kpwie sBY dlu bwnI ]
transliteration: Kaaloo Samet Sabhai Saktoo Mil(i) Doono Khapaae Sabhaoo Dal(u) Baanoo||
translation: “Alongwith Kali and other powers thou hast destroyed all the parts of my army.”

gurmukhi: cMf kihE muK qy aun ko qyaU qw iCn gaur ky m`iD smwnI ]
transliteration: Channd Kahio Moukh Te Oun Ko Teoo Taa Chin Gaddd Ke Maddh(i) Samaanoo||
translation: At that time Chandi uttered these words from her month to Kali and other powers: “Merge in me” and at the same instant they all merged in Chandi;

gurmukhi: ijau srqw ky pÍwh ky bIc imlY brKw bhu bUMdn pwnI ]214]
transliteration: Jio Sartaa Ke Pravaah Ke Boodhe Milai Barkhaa Bahu Boondan Paanoo||214||
translation: Like the rain-water in the current of the steam.214.

gurmukhi: kY bil cMif mhwN rn m`iD su lY jmdwV kI qw pr lweI ]
transliteration: Kai Bal(i) Channd(i) Mahaan Ran Maddh(i) Su Lai Jamdaad Koo Taa Par Laaoo||
translation: In the war, Chnadi, taking the dagger, struck it with great force on the demon.

gurmukhi: bYT geI Air ky aur mY iqh sRaunq ju`gin pUr AGweI ]
transliteration: Baith Gado Ar(i) Ke Ur Mai Tih Sraounat Judgad(i) Poor Aghaaoo||
translation: It penetrated into the breast of the enemy; the vamps were fully satisfied with his blood.

gurmukhi: dIrG ju`Du iblok kY bu`D kvIsÍr ky mn mY ieh AweI ]
transliteration: Dooragh Juddh(u) Bilok Kai Buddh Kavoosvar Ke Men Mai Eh Aaoo||
translation: Seeing that horrible war, the poet hath imagined it like this:

gurmukhi: loQ pY loQ geI pr ieau su mno sur log kI sIFI bnweI ]215]
transliteration: Loth Pai Loth Gado Par Io Su Mano Sur Log Koo Soodhoo Banaaoo||215||
translation: The corpses falling on one another seem like a ladder of heaven made by the warriors in the war.215.

gurmukhi: suMB cmUM sMg cMfkw kRu`D kY ju`D Anykin vwr micE hY ]
transliteration: Soonbh Chamoond San Channdakaa Kruddh Kai Juddh Anekan(i) Vaar Machio Hai||
translation: Chandi, with great rage, hath waged war several times with the forces of Sumbh.

gurmukhi: jMbuk ju`gn giRJ mjUr rkqR kI kIc mY eIs nicE hY ]
transliteration: Janbouk Judgad Grijjh Majoor Raktra Koo Rooch Mai Oos Nachio Hai||
translation: The jackals, vamps and vultures are like laborers and the dancer standing in the mud of flesh and blood is Shiva himself.

gurmukhi: lu`Q pY lu`Q su BIqY BeI isq gUd Aau myd lY qwih gicE hY ]
transliteration: Loutth Pai Loutth Su Bhootai Bhaoo Sit Good Au Med Lai Taah(i) Gadhio Hai||
translation: The corpses upon corpses have become a wall and the fat and marrow are the plaster (on that wall).

gurmukhi: Baun rMgIn bnwie mno kirmwivs icqR bicqR ricE hY ]216]
transliteration: Bhaoun Ranoon Banaae Mano Karimaavis Chitra Bachitra Rachio Hai||216||
translation: (This is not the battlefield) it appears that Vishwakarma, the builder of beautiful mansions, hath created this wonderful portrait. 216.

gurmukhi: duMd su ju`Du BieE rn mY auq suMB ieqY br cMf sMBwrI ]
transliteration: Dound Su Juddh(u) Bhaio Ran Mai Out Sounbh Itai Bar Channd Sanbhdaroo||
translation: Ultimately there was battle only between the two, Sumbh from that side and Chandi from this side, sustained their power.
